Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the Azure Public IP, including the type of IP (static or dynamic), SKU (standard or basic), and region. Identify the applications and services that will use the Public IP.
Plan the allocation of Public IP addresses, ensuring proper segmentation and alignment with the organization's network architecture.
Secure approvals from stakeholders and network administrators for the allocation and use of Public IP addresses.
Provision a Public IP address in the Azure portal, CLI, or PowerShell. Specify the type, SKU, and region during creation.
Set up DNS name labels for the Public IP if required. Ensure proper naming conventions and alignment with organizational standards.
Apply security controls such as Network Security Groups (NSGs) and Azure Firewall to protect resources associated with the Public IP.
Verify the functionality of the Public IP by testing connectivity to associated resources. Ensure proper routing and DNS resolution.
Set up monitoring for the Public IP using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher. Configure alerts for availability and performance metrics.
Create detailed documentation of the Public IP setup, including configurations, DNS settings, and security measures.
Ensure the Public IP setup complies with organizational policies and regulatory requirements. Conduct regular audits to verify compliance.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and availability of Azure Public IP addresses. Investigate any anomalies or downtime.
Ensure DNS settings associated with Azure Public IP addresses are correctly configured and resolve to the intended endpoints.
Audit the allocation of Public IP addresses to ensure optimal usage and compliance with organizational policies.
Review and update Network Security Groups (NSGs) and firewall rules to ensure secure access to resources using Azure Public IP addresses.
Regularly back up configurations related to Azure Public IP addresses, including DNS settings and associated resources.
Perform failover tests to ensure that resources using Azure Public IP addresses can recover seamlessly in case of outages.
Conduct regular audits to ensure that Azure Public IP addresses are being used efficiently and are not exceeding cost thresholds.
Rotate access keys and credentials associated with resources using Azure Public IP addresses to maintain security compliance.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare for potential security incidents or outages involving Azure Public IP addresses.
Check expiration dates for reserved Public IP addresses and renew them as necessary to avoid service disruptions.
Analyze usage patterns and optimize the allocation of Azure Public IP addresses to reduce costs and improve efficiency.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new features and best practices for Azure Public IP management.
